TravelTriangle > Blog > Rajasthan > 11 Ancient Yet Famous Religious Places In Rajasthan One Must Definitely Visit While In The Land Of Deserts! 11 Ancient Yet Famous Religious Places In Rajasthan One Must Definitely Visit While In The Land Of Deserts! .. SHARES Updated Date: 6 June 2023 Rajasthan is not just the land of royalty and palaces, but there are some of the ancient temples which reflects the ages old culture. There are several temples in India but Rajasthan plays a huge role. Rajasthan is situated in the north western part of the Indian subcontinent. The capital city of Rajasthan in Jaipur. Rajasthan is known as Rajputana because it is the country of the Rajputs. The entire state looks like one beautiful vessel which impresses you from each and every corner of it. There are many forts, palaces, havelis, and most importantly several temples which makes most of the state. All these temples are very famous because they are built at the time of kings before 19 century and thus they have a great historical importance to them. So here are few famous religious places in Rajasthan which one cannot miss out when they are visiting the state. Table Of Content 11 Best Religious Places In Rajasthan Here is a handpicked list of the best 11 Religious Places In Rajasthan which will definitely make your travel experience to the Rajputana state a memorable one. 1. Birla Mandir Birla Mandir is one of the major and famous religious tourist places in India. It is situated in the capital city of Rajasthan, Jaipur. This temple is built in 1998 around 20th century by Birla family and it is devoted to Lakshmi and lord Vishnu. This temple is situated at the mountains of Moti Dungari in the city of Jaipur. This temple mainly has three domes those portrait different religions of the country. You can also find different statues philosophers and religions. During sunset this temple shows its beauty and richness in architecture due to its lights decorated all over it. The entry fees of Birla Mandir is free. Temple Timings: 6 – 12AM, 3 – 9PM, open 7 days a weekAddress: Birla Mandir, Jawaharlal Lal Nehru Marg, Tilak Nagar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302022 Must Read: 9 Best Places To Visit Near Sikar To Get Closer To The Rajasthani Roots Rajasthan Holiday Packages On TravelTriangle Riveting Udaipur Vacation 3D/2N Package @ Rs 6,499 Plan your trip today! Talk to our travel experts today. Book Now Romantic Rajasthan Tour Package 11D/10N @ Rs 28,000 Best prices guaranteed. EMI option available. Book Now See more at TRAVELTRIANGLE.COM Visit Website 2. Brahma Temple Brahma Mandir or Brahma Temple is 2000 years old temple. It is situated near to Pushkar Lake. This temple is devoted to Lord Brahma and some statues of Lord Saraswathi are also seen here. It is believed that Lord Brahma came to earth and did a yajna at the same spot where this temple is built now. This temple is made up of white marbles and stone slabs and it has the highest tower which can be seen from far. Temple Timings: 6AM – 9PMAddress: Brahma Temple Road, Ganahera, Pushkar, Rajasthan 305022 Suggested Read: 14 Places To Visit Near Alwar That’ll Help You Make Your Rajasthan Trip More Productive 3. Karni Mata Temple Karni Mata Temple is situated in Bikaner and this is exclusively situated to Goddess Mata Karni who is considered to be an epitome of Goddess Durga. The main ritual of this temple is to feed the rats. It has more than 20000 black rats in this temple. So it is famously known as rat temple. It was built by Maharaja Ganga Singh of Bikaner in the 20th century in splendid Mughal style. Devotees place bowls of milk on the floor, which is then enjoyed by the rats which is to bring about good luck and prosperity. The entry fees are free. Temple Timings: 5AM – 10PMAddress: NH89, Deshnok, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334801 Suggested Read: Find Out The Best Places To Visit In Sikar: Rajasthan’s Hidden Gem! 4. Eklingji Temple Eklingji Temple is an architectural marvel, situated in the vicinity of the city of Udaipur at Kailashpuri, Rajasthan. Eklingji Temple is situated on the bank of Indersagar Lake at a distance of 22 km from Udaipur. It’s a famous pilgrimage attraction dedicated to Lord Eklingji. This is an 8th century temple. The main ritual of this temple is worshipping Lord Shiva. On Mondays especially you will have lot of rituals. This is very famous temple during times of Maha Shiva Ratri. You can have a free entrance here. Temple Timings: 4:15AM – 6:45AM, 10:30AM – 1:30PM, 5:15PM – 7:45PMAddress: Shri EklingJi Temple, Udaipur, Delvada Marg, Eklingji, Rajasthan 313202 Suggested Read: Explore Top 13 Things To Do In Sikar: The Magnificent Desert City Of Rajasthan! 5. Galtaji Temple Galtaji temple is a pre-historic Hindu pilgrimage site which is situated only 10km away from Jaipur. This temple is built in the 18th century and is famously known as the Monkey Temple. Placed in the Aravali hills, Galtaji Temple is surrounded by hills. There are many holy water tanks in this temple. It is built with pink sandstone all over the temple. So its architecture is very famous. Temple is filled with different paintings on its walls. There is a stone named “Gaumukh” in this temple which resembles the head of the cow from which all the tanks in the temple gets water. It gives crystal clear water. Entrance fee is free to visit this temple. Sometimes they may ask for donations or charges for cameras. Temple Timings: 5AM – 9PMAddress: Shri Galta Peetham, Galva Ashrama, Jaipur, Rajasthan, 302013. Mehandipur Balaji Temple Mehandipur Balaji Mandir is a noted Hindu temple in Dausa district of Rajasthan, dedicated to one of the Hindu God Hanuman. This temple is placed in the Kaurali district to worship the Lord Hanuman. Ritual healing processes would be performed by saints inside the temple. There is no entry fee to enter into this temple. Temple Timings: 4AM – 10PMAddress: Bandikui Railway Station, 3 Km from Jaipur-Agra National Highway, Dausa, Rajasthan 303303, India. Suggested Read: 15 Places To Visit In Rajasthan In January Which Has Something More Than Just The Palaces! 7. Sai Dham A visit to the Sai Temple which has been set up recently in close vicinity of Char Dham in Namchi is a visual treat as well as a great spiritual experience. This temple is situated in Pali district. Sai-Dham at Rani, (Rajasthan) is a replica of original Shirdi Sai Baba Temple. Sai dham Mandir, Jodhpur is a perfect destination for a great time with your dear ones. The entry is free. Temple Timings: 6:00 PM – 8:00 AMAddress: Kaveri Path, Mansarovar, Mansarovar Sector 1, Mansarovar, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302020. Suggested Read: Get The Rajasthani Bohemia On! 17 Amazing Shopping Places In Jaipur To Explore! 8. Rani Sati Temple Rani Sati Temple is situated in Rajasthan in the district of Jhunjhunu. People of Rajasthan often tells the about Rani Sati as an inspiration due to her great pride and personality. She has been called as Dadi Ji by the people. This is built in the 13th century. This is called as the largest temple in the country. Rani Sati killed herself after the death of her husband. The temple is full of marble stone. It contains large picture framed of Rani Sati. There are also Hanuman temple, Lord Shiva temple, Lord Ganesh temple, Sita temple and others in this temple. It has sanctum sanctorum which symbolizes pride, strength, act of braveness and boldness. Every day in the morning and in the evening special Aarti is lit at this temple. Temple Timings: 5:30AM – 1PM; 3PM – 10:30PMAddress: Rani Sati Mandir, Chobari Mandi Colony, Jhunjhunu, Rajasthan 333001 Suggested Read: 7 Places To Visit Near Rajasthan For A Cultural Holiday Experience 9. Ambika Mata Temple Ambika Mata temple can be seen near Udaipur about 50km away. It is situated in the village, Jagat. This temple mainly worships Goddess Durga. It is renowned for its exquisite carvings which lend it a resemblance to the famous Khajuraho temples in Madhya Pradesh. The temple is looked after today by archaeology department. This temple is called as the Khajuraho of Mewar. You can find different sculptures of musicians, dancers and many artists. This temple is also dedicated to Jainism. Temple Timings: 6AM – 7PMAddress: MDR 11, Udaipur, Rajasthan 313905. Suggested Read: 7 Places To Visit In Kishangarh: Unveiling The Best Of Rajasthan! 10. Ranakpur Jain Temple Ranakpur Jain temple is also called as Chaturmukha Dharana Vihara.This temple is devoted to Tirthankara Rishabhanatha. The temple location is in a village of Ranakpur near Sadri town which is situated in Pali district of Rajasthan. It is situated almost 90 km away from Udaipur with an excellent scenic view. It has an overall area of 48,000 square feet. You will find a 6 feet statue of Lord Adinath who is the first Tirthankara in Jain history. The specialty of this temple is that no two pillars have the same design but are sculpted in a very unique and impressive way. There is an entry fee of Rs.200 for foreigners and extra for camera/mobile. Temple Timings: 12PM – 5PMAddress: Desuri, Ranakpur Rd, Sadri, Rajasthan 306702. Suggested Read: 14 Places To Visit In Rajasthan In Monsoon For Those Who Love Rains! 11. Dilwara Jain Temples, Mount Abu Dilwara Temples or Delvada Temples are situated about 2½ kilometers from Mount Abu settlement, Rajasthan’s only hill station. India is dotted with number of Jain temples mostly in Rajasthan. This temple is mainly built in the 11th and 13th centuries AD by Vipul Shah and Vastupal Tejpal. Dilwara Jain Temples is one of the finest Jain temple known world over due to its magnificent architecture and also a very fine stone carvings on its walls done with marbles. The entrance ticket price of this place is the official fee for entry to and visit of the place during its opening times. Temple Timings: 12PM – 6PMAddress: Delwara, Mount Abu, Rajasthan 307501. Further Read: Monsoon In Jaisalmer: A Guide To See The Best Sights Of The Golden City Of Rajasthan! If you are visiting Rajasthan soon, don’t forget to head to some of the above religious places in Rajasthan and explore the history and the stories associated with each. Visiting temples can be a great activity on your trip to rajasthan with your family. These holy places are some of the ancient establishments which will definitely give a close glimpse into the heritage of the state. So, when you plan a holiday in Rajasthan make sure to enjoy a time like never before by visiting these places. Frequently Asked Questions About Religious Places In Rajasthan What is the famous temple of Rajasthan? Birla Mandir in Jaipur city is the most famous temple in Rajasthan. Birla Mandir which is built in Jaipur is also popularly known as Lakshmi Narayan Temple. This temple is situated on Moti Dungari hill. There are in total 18 famous Birla Mandirs situated all around the country apart from Rajasthan. How to book a tour to Rajasthan? Rajasthan Tour Packages are mostly available for 9 nights and 10 days tour. You need 10 days to cover most of the tourist places that are situated in Rajasthan. This package suits the best so that you can visit to Jaipur which is the capital city and other cities like Mount Abu, Ranakpur, Jaisalmer, Shekhawati, Jodhpur, Ajmer, Pushkar, Bikaner, and Udaipur. What is the best time to visit Rajasthan? During winter from the month of October to March you can visit Rajasthan because the temperature during this time is likely to have a vacation and enjoy the trip. You can also visit during summer especially from months of April to June because climate will be hot and humid. What are the special dishes one should try on the trip to Rajasthan? The best known food of Rajasthan is the combination of Daal, Baati and Choorma, along with pickles and buttermilk. The daal is made of different lentils. Baati is bread which is in round shape which is often cooked by baking it in a charcoal fire with butter inside. Choorma is a famous sweet dish of Rajasthan which is made of bread, jaggery and ghee. Can we reach Rajasthan through train? The major cities of Rajasthan have a very good network of railheads that connects the state with the other parts of the country. A number of luxury express and passengers trains and helps tourists to explore the destination. What are some of the Best resorts to stay in Rajasthan? Rajasthan resorts are mainly famous for its forts and palaces. One can also stay at these palaces which provide royal luxuries that give us a rich feel. Resorts here give very luxurious stay with all sorts of amenities reminding the life of royal kings in olden days. Some of the places you’ll love are, 1. Mihir Garh, Jodhpur 2. Ramathra Fort, Sapotra 3. Taj Lake Palace, Udaipur 4. Gajner Palace, Bikaner 5. Lallgarh Palace, Bikaner 6. The Oberoi Udaivillas, Udaipur What is Rajasthan famous for? Rajasthan is the biggest Indian state. It contains many tourist cities with different cultures and traditions. Jaipur, the capital city of Rajasthan, is famous for its forts and palaces. It is also called as pink city. It is also called as the best place for tourism. Looking To Book A Holiday Package? Spellbinding Cochin Family Tour 2D/1N Package @ Rs 2,750 Plan your trip today!
